How Many Countries Are There In The World? Total Number (2023) If you're wondering how many countries are there in the world, here's a complete number & list! The total may be 193, 195, 197, or even 199. 4.6K How many countries are there in the world? According to the United Nations member list, there may be as few as 193 countries or as many as 197, but the real answer is a bit more complicated than that. What about places like Kosovo and Taiwan? Are they countries? Even though they‚Äôre unrecognized by the UN and may be politically controversial, they meet all of the criteria to be considered sovereign states. In this article, I‚Äôll explain some of these issues and why it‚Äôs hard to come to an exact tally of the world‚Äôs countries. Then I‚Äôll give my opinion on why I think the real total is at least 199 countries, and probably even more. This topic interests me because I‚Äôm on a journey myself to someday visit every country in the world, as you can see on my travel blog. But before I can do that, I first have to figure out how many countries there are! Let‚Äôs get started! Contents hide 1) What Is A Country? (Definition)2) How Many Countries In The World? (UN Definition)3) Is Taiwan A Country? Yes4) Is Kosovo A Country? Yes5) Full List Of Countries In The World6) So How Many Countries Are There In The World?7) Frequently Asked Questions 8) ‚Ä¢ What Is The World‚Äôs Newest Country?9) ‚Ä¢ What Is The World‚Äôs Oldest Country?10) ‚Ä¢ What Is The World‚Äôs Biggest Country?11) ‚Ä¢ What Is The World‚Äôs Smallest Country?12) ‚Ä¢ What Is The Most Populous Country?13) ‚Ä¢ What Is My Favorite Country?14) My Journey To Visit Every Country What Is A Country? (Definition) The Oxford dictionary defines a country as ‚Äúa nation with its own government, occupying a particular territory.‚Äù The Britannica dictionary gives a similar definition. Meanwhile, the Cambridge dictionary defines a country as ‚Äúan area of land that has its own government, army, etc.‚Äù We‚Äôll come back to these definitions later, because they may be helpful for understanding how to classify disputed countries. How Many Countries In The World? (UN Definition) So how many countries are there in the world? The best place to start is the United Nations member list. It‚Äôs not perfect, but it‚Äôs quite comprehensive and includes most of the countries of the world. When we look at the United Nations list, here is what we see:
  • 193 UN member states
  • 2 UN General Assembly non-member observer states (Palestine, Holy See)
  • 2 eligible non-member states (Cook Islands, Niue)
If you add all of these up, you get a total of 193, 195, or 197 countries. Under the strictest definition (UN membership) there would be 193 countries, or under the loosest definition (all eligible states) there would be 197. I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs fair to exclude a country from the total just because it‚Äôs not a UN member, as long as it‚Äôs eligible for membership and meets all the criteria for being considered a country, so it‚Äôs only logical to say that there are a total of 197 countries. So there you have it ‚Äî 197 countries! We‚Äôre done, right? Wrong. There‚Äôs still the issue of Kosovo and Taiwan, which are unrecognized by the UN. So how do we classify them? Taiwan isn‚Äôt recognized by the UN, but it fits any definition of a sovereign country. ¬† Is Taiwan A Country? Yes In 1949, Communist forces took control of mainland China in a civil war, forcing out the leaders of the Republic of China and its followers, who fled to the island of Formosa (Taiwan). Since then, Taiwan has been an independently governed country with its own flag, currency, military, constitution, widely accepted passport, and an independently elected president. Taiwan was one of the original founding members of the United Nations, and it was still recognized as the sole legitimate representative of China by a majority of UN members until the 1970s, when mainland China‚Äôs influence began to grow rapidly and Taiwan was voted out of the UN in their favor. Today, China tries to claim ownership over Taiwan, and it gets touchy when anyone calls Taiwan a country. Basically, the rest of the world wants to preserve their relationship with mainland China, which is now an economic power, so they‚Äôre hesitant to recognize Taiwan. Taiwan is officially recognized by 13 UN member states, and it maintains unofficial relations with around 100 nations, including the United States and Japan. The only reason it‚Äôs not officially considered a country by the UN is because of politics. So in conclusion, yes, Taiwan is a country! It meets and exceeds the criteria in every way. We had a lot of fun traveling in Taiwan ¬† Is Kosovo A Country? Yes Kosovo split off from the European country of Serbia in 2008, and it‚Äôs acted as an independent country since then. They have their own flag, passport, armed forces, and constitution. Even though Kosovo has diplomatic recognition as a sovereign state by 101 member states of the United Nations, it hasn‚Äôt been allowed membership in the UN and the European Union because Serbia continues to claim Kosovo as its own, with Serbia‚Äôs ally Russia backing it up. Basically, politics is the only reason anyone would deny that Kosovo is a country. Nevertheless, Kosovo is an independent country in every sense of the word, so it‚Äôs only logical to include it in the total number. Full List Of Countries In The World Here is an alphabetical list of all the countries in the world, according to the United Nations. This is the official UN member list from their website. ¬π UN non-member observer states ¬≤ UN eligible non-member states ¬≥ Unrecognized by UN So How Many Countries Are There In The World? As you can see, it‚Äôs hard to say exactly how many countries there are in the world. The short answer is that there are 193 member countries in the United Nations, plus 2 non-member observer states, 2 eligible non-member states, and 2 independent states that are unrecognized by the UN. In conclusion, with this logic I think it‚Äôs fair to say that there are at least 199 countries in the world. My inner OCD wants it to be an even 200, but at the moment that‚Äôs not the case! Frequently Asked Questions ‚Ä¢ What Is The World‚Äôs Newest Country? The newest (or youngest) country in the world is currently South Sudan in Africa, which split from Sudan in 2011. It has almost 13 million people, and its capital and largest city is Juba. Before that, the world‚Äôs newest UN-recognized country was Montenegro in Europe, which separated from Serbia in 2006. ‚Ä¢ What Is The World‚Äôs Oldest Country? It‚Äôs hard to pinpoint the world‚Äôs oldest country, but some contenders are China, Egypt, India, Iran, and Japan. The Egypt pyramids were built in 2560 BC. Now that‚Äôs old! ¬† ‚Ä¢ What Is The World‚Äôs Biggest Country? The world‚Äôs biggest country is Russia by far, with a total area of 17,098,242 square kilometers (6,601,665 mi¬≤). Russia spans 11 time zones across two continents (Asia and Europe) and covers one-tenth of all the land on Earth. The second and third biggest countries in the world are Canada and the United States, respectively. The UK could fit into Canada more than 40 times! There‚Äôs a lot of wonderful nature in both of these countries, with diverse landscapes and lots of freedom to roam. Read More: Largest Countries In The World The United States is the 3rd biggest country in the world. ¬† ‚Ä¢ What Is The World‚Äôs Smallest Country? The world‚Äôs smallest country in area and population is the Holy See ‚Äî the Vatican City has a population of 800 people and an area of 44 hectares (109 acres). If you go by UN membership strictly, the world‚Äôs smallest country in terms of area is Monaco, which covers 202 hectares (499 acres). It has a population of about 40,000 people, making it the most densely populated country in the world. Another interesting country is Nauru, which is a remote little island of 21 square kilometers (8 mi¬≤). It‚Äôs the world‚Äôs least populous country among UN membership states, and the 2nd smallest UN country by area. ‚Ä¢ What Is The Most Populous Country? China is currently the world‚Äôs most populous country, with 1.44 billion people. However, India is expected to surpass this number soon, putting it ahead of China. ‚Ä¢ What Is My Favorite Country? A lot of people ask me about my favorite places to travel. I love to travel in Bali and the rest of Indonesia, of course! Bali is budget friendly, warm, and there‚Äôs so much to see and do. I also love the people of Bali and that‚Äôs why I married one of them. üôÇ Outside of Indonesia, it gets tougher for me to choose favorites. We‚Äôve really enjoyed places like Japan, Egypt, Myanmar, Hawaii, etc. There are very few places we‚Äôve traveled that we didn‚Äôt like in some way or another, even in spite of their flaws. My wife Intan and I wearing Balinese traditional dress in Indonesia ¬† My Journey To Visit Every Country Thanks for looking! I hope you enjoyed this discussion of how many countries are there in the world in 2022. Don‚Äôt forget to bookmark my travel blog for tips, info, and photos from my own journey to visit every country on Earth. Happy travels! See Also

Western Sahara is also recognized by 45 UN member states (at one time it was 84 UN member states but many of those have since withdrawn recognition). I‚Äôm still not sure if it would qualify as an independent country though, since Western Sahara is mostly governed by Morocco. Even the biggest city Laayoune is administered by Morocco. The SADR group has their own currency and a passport accepted by countries that recognize SADR, but they mainly use Moroccan currency. The UN officially classifies Western Sahara as a non-self-governing territory because it‚Äôs mainly administered by the Moroccan government. answer: ::PLAN Use the list of countries from the United Nations member list as a reference to identify the legislation websites for each country.
::END_RESULT There are 193 member countries in the United Nations. However, there may be additional countries not recognized by the UN.

goal: For ever country in the world, identify where the websites where their legislation can be found online. If a country have a multiple law applicable identify them all.
args: There are 193 member countries in the United Nations. However, there may be additional countries not recognized by the UN.
